page.title: 10Recreation.
page.content: Since Crail has two beaches, the children enjoy themselves there in Summer, or hire bikes, while the adults can play golf at the nearby Balcomie Golf Course and several others; or go for walks along the coast to St. Andrews or to Anstruther.Birdwatching is popular. There are many kinds of sea birds, and the usual field and meadow species. There has been a colony of collared doves since 1963. A bowling club with rinks is open to visitors. Tennis and putting are availble with clubs,racquets and balls supplied. The local people show an interest in gardening, there is Bingo and the odd Coffee Evening. Boats sail from the harbour to the May Island.
